divineascension:handbook-blessings-text:
Blessings Commands

Commands for managing and viewing your divine blessings. Blessings grant stat modifiers and special effects based on your deity. You must be in a religion to use most blessing commands.

Player Commands

/blessings list
Lists all available blessings for your deity. Displays both unlocked and locked blessings with their requirements.
Example: /blessings list

/blessings player
Shows all player-level blessings you have unlocked, including their effects and stat modifiers.
Example: /blessings player

/blessings religion
Shows all religion-level blessings unlocked by your religion. These blessings apply to all members of your religion.
Example: /blessings religion

/blessings info <blessingId>
Displays detailed information about a specific blessing, including requirements, prerequisites, stat modifiers, and special effects.
Parameters:
• blessingId (required) - The unique identifier of the blessing (e.g., khoras_mining_efficiency_1)
Example: /blessings info khoras_mining_efficiency_1

/blessings tree [player|religion]
Displays the blessing tree showing unlock paths and prerequisites. Specify 'player' for personal blessings or 'religion' for religion blessings.
Parameters:
• type (optional) - Either 'player' or 'religion' (default: player)
Example: /blessings tree player

/blessings unlock <blessingId>
Unlocks a blessing if you meet the requirements (favor rank, prerequisites, favor cost). Consumes favor points when unlocking.
Parameters:
• blessingId (required) - The blessing to unlock
Example: /blessings unlock khoras_mining_efficiency_1

/blessings active
Shows all currently active blessings and their combined stat modifiers. Displays both player and religion blessings.
Example: /blessings active

Admin Commands (require admin privileges)

/blessings admin unlock <blessingId> [playername]
Force unlocks a blessing for a player, bypassing all requirements including favor rank, prerequisites, and favor cost.
Parameters:
• blessingId (required) - The blessing to unlock
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /blessings admin unlock khoras_health_boost PlayerName

/blessings admin lock <blessingId> [playername]
Removes an unlocked blessing from a player. Does not refund favor points.
Parameters:
• blessingId (required) - The blessing to remove
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /blessings admin lock khoras_health_boost PlayerName

/blessings admin reset [playername]
Clears all unlocked blessings for a player. Removes both player and religion blessings.
Parameters:
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /blessings admin reset PlayerName

/blessings admin unlockall [playername]
Unlocks all available blessings for a player's deity. Bypasses all requirements.
Parameters:
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /blessings admin unlockall PlayerName

See also:
Religion Commands • Favor Commands
divineascension:handbook-religion-text:
Religion Commands

Commands for creating and managing religions. Religions are groups of players who follow the same deity and share blessings, favor bonuses, and civilization alliances.

Management Commands

/religion create <name> <deity> [visibility]
Create a new religion. You become the founder with full permissions.
Parameters:
• name (required) - Religion name (alphanumeric with spaces)
• deity (required) - Deity name: Khoras, Lysa, Aethra, or Gaia
• visibility (optional) - Either 'public' or 'private' (default: public)
Example: /religion create "Holy Order" Khoras public

/religion join <name>
Join a public religion or accept an invitation to a private religion. You must leave your current religion first.
Parameters:
• name (required) - Religion name to join
Example: /religion join "Holy Order"

/religion leave
Leave your current religion. If you are the founder, the oldest member becomes the new founder. If you are the sole member, the religion is disbanded.
Example: /religion leave

/religion disband
Disband your religion (founder only). All members are removed and all blessings are lost.
Example: /religion disband

/religion description <text>
Set your religion's description (founder or members with permission).
Parameters:
• text (required) - Description text
Example: /religion description "We follow the path of the forge"

Information Commands

/religion list [deity]
List all public religions, optionally filtered by deity.
Parameters:
• deity (optional) - Filter by deity: Khoras, Lysa, Aethra, or Gaia
Example: /religion list Khoras

/religion info [name]
Show detailed information about a religion including members, blessings, prestige, and civilization.
Parameters:
• name (optional) - Religion name (default: your religion)
Example: /religion info "Holy Order"

/religion members
Show all members of your religion with their roles and favor ranks.
Example: /religion members

Member Management Commands

/religion invite <playername>
Invite a player to your religion (founder or members with permission).
Parameters:
• playername (required) - Player to invite
Example: /religion invite PlayerName

/religion kick <playername>
Kick a player from your religion (founder or members with permission). Cannot kick the founder.
Parameters:
• playername (required) - Player to kick
Example: /religion kick PlayerName

/religion ban <playername> [reason] [days]
Ban a player from your religion (founder or members with permission). Banned players cannot rejoin.
Parameters:
• playername (required) - Player to ban
• reason (optional) - Ban reason
• days (optional) - Ban duration in days (default: permanent)
Example: /religion ban PlayerName "Disruptive behavior" 7

/religion unban <playername>
Unban a player from your religion (founder or members with permission).
Parameters:
• playername (required) - Player to unban
Example: /religion unban PlayerName

/religion banlist
List all banned players with ban reasons and expiration dates.
Example: /religion banlist

Prestige Commands

/religion prestige info [religionname]
View detailed prestige information for a religion including rank, total prestige, and progression.
Parameters:
• religionname (optional) - Religion name (default: your religion)
Example: /religion prestige info "Holy Order"

/religion prestige add <religionname> <amount> [reason] (Admin)
Add prestige to a religion. Use for testing or special events.
Parameters:
• religionname (required) - Target religion
• amount (required) - Prestige amount to add
• reason (optional) - Reason for prestige grant
Example: /religion prestige add "Holy Order" 100 "Event reward"

/religion prestige set <religionname> <amount> (Admin)
Set religion prestige to a specific amount.
Parameters:
• religionname (required) - Target religion
• amount (required) - New prestige value
Example: /religion prestige set "Holy Order" 500

Admin Commands (require admin privileges)

/religion admin repair [playername]
Repair religion membership inconsistencies for a player. Use if a player shows wrong religion data.
Parameters:
• playername (optional) - Player to repair (default: all players)
Example: /religion admin repair PlayerName

/religion admin join <religionname> [playername]
Force add a player to a religion, bypassing invitations and bans.
Parameters:
• religionname (required) - Target religion
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /religion admin join "Holy Order" PlayerName

/religion admin leave [playername]
Force remove a player from their religion. If the player is a founder with members, transfers founder status first.
Parameters:
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /religion admin leave PlayerName

See also:
Roles Commands • Blessings Commands • Civilization Commands
divineascension:handbook-roles-text:
Roles Commands

Commands for managing custom roles and permissions within your religion. Roles control who can invite, kick, ban, and manage religion settings.

Built-in Roles: Founder (full permissions), Member (basic permissions)

Management Commands

/religion roles
View all roles in your religion with their permission counts.
Example: /religion roles

/religion transfer <playername>
Transfer founder status to another member (founder only). You become a regular member after transfer.
Parameters:
• playername (required) - New founder
Example: /religion transfer PlayerName

/religion role create <name>
Create a custom role with default permissions (founder only).
Parameters:
• name (required) - Role name (alphanumeric with spaces)
Example: /religion role create "Elder"

/religion role delete <name>
Delete a custom role (founder only). Cannot delete built-in roles (Founder, Member). All members with this role revert to Member role.
Parameters:
• name (required) - Role name to delete
Example: /religion role delete "Elder"

/religion role rename <oldname> <newname>
Rename a custom role (founder only). Cannot rename built-in roles.
Parameters:
• oldname (required) - Current role name
• newname (required) - New role name
Example: /religion role rename "Elder" "High Priest"

Assignment Commands

/religion role assign <playername> <rolename>
Assign a role to a member (founder only). Players can only have one role at a time.
Parameters:
• playername (required) - Target player
• rolename (required) - Role to assign
Example: /religion role assign PlayerName "Elder"

/religion role members <rolename>
View all members who have a specific role.
Parameters:
• rolename (required) - Role to query
Example: /religion role members "Elder"

Permission Commands

/religion role grant <rolename> <permission>
Grant a permission to a role (founder only).
Parameters:
• rolename (required) - Target role
• permission (required) - Permission to grant: Invite, Kick, Ban, ManageRoles, UnlockBlessings, SetDescription
Example: /religion role grant "Elder" Invite

/religion role revoke <rolename> <permission>
Revoke a permission from a role (founder only).
Parameters:
• rolename (required) - Target role
• permission (required) - Permission to revoke
Example: /religion role revoke "Elder" Kick

/religion role permissions <rolename>
View all permissions granted to a role.
Parameters:
• rolename (required) - Role to query
Example: /religion role permissions "Elder"

Available Permissions:
• Invite - Invite new members to the religion
• Kick - Remove members from the religion
• Ban - Ban and unban players
• ManageRoles - Assign roles to members
• UnlockBlessings - Unlock religion-level blessings
• SetDescription - Change religion description

See also:
Religion Commands
divineascension:handbook-favor-text:
Favor Commands

Commands for viewing and managing divine favor. Favor is earned by performing deity-aligned activities and determines your devotion rank. Higher ranks unlock more powerful blessings.

Devotion Ranks: Initiate (0), Disciple (500), Zealot (2000), Champion (5000), Avatar (10000)

Player Commands

/favor or /favor get
Check your current divine favor and devotion rank.
Example: /favor

/favor info
View detailed favor information including current favor, lifetime favor earned, devotion rank, progress to next rank, and blessing unlock eligibility.
Example: /favor info

/favor stats
View comprehensive favor statistics including favor earned from different activities (mining, crafting, hunting, foraging, etc.) and favor spent on blessings.
Example: /favor stats

/favor ranks
List all devotion ranks with their favor requirements and blessing unlock tiers.
Example: /favor ranks

How to Earn Favor:
• Passive Generation - 0.5 favor per hour (all deities)
• Deity-Aligned Activities - Performing actions aligned with your deity grants bonus favor:
- Khoras: Mining, smithing, anvil work, smelting
- Lysa: Hunting, combat, PvP
- Aethra: Farming, foraging, cooking
- Gaia: Gathering, exploring, animal taming

Admin Commands (require admin privileges)

/favor set <amount> [playername]
Set a player's current favor to a specific amount. Does not affect lifetime favor or devotion rank.
Parameters:
• amount (required) - New favor value
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /favor set 100 PlayerName

/favor add <amount> [playername]
Add favor to a player's current favor. Does not affect lifetime favor or devotion rank.
Parameters:
• amount (required) - Favor amount to add
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /favor add 50 PlayerName

/favor remove <amount> [playername]
Remove favor from a player. Cannot go below zero.
Parameters:
• amount (required) - Favor amount to remove
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /favor remove 25 PlayerName

/favor reset [playername]
Reset a player's current favor to 0. Does not affect lifetime favor or devotion rank.
Parameters:
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /favor reset PlayerName

/favor max [playername]
Set a player's favor to the maximum value (100,000). Does not affect lifetime favor or devotion rank.
Parameters:
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /favor max PlayerName

/favor settotal <amount> [playername]
Set a player's total favor earned and automatically update their devotion rank. This affects blessing unlock eligibility.
Parameters:
• amount (required) - New lifetime favor earned value
• playername (optional) - Target player (default: yourself)
Example: /favor settotal 5000 PlayerName

See also:
Blessings Commands • Religion Commands
divineascension:handbook-civilization-te:
Civilization Commands

Commands for creating and managing civilizations. Civilizations are alliances of 1-4 religions with different deities, providing diplomatic and strategic advantages.

Rules: Each religion can only be in one civilization. Religions must have different deities to form a civilization.

Management Commands

/civ create <name>
Create a new civilization with your religion as the founding member (founder only). You become the civilization founder.
Parameters:
• name (required) - Civilization name (alphanumeric with spaces)
Example: /civ create "Grand Alliance"

/civ invite <religionname>
Invite a religion to join your civilization (founder only). The invited religion's founder receives the invitation.
Parameters:
• religionname (required) - Religion to invite
Example: /civ invite "Holy Order"

/civ accept <inviteid>
Accept a civilization invitation (religion founder only). Joins your religion to the civilization.
Parameters:
• inviteid (required) - Invitation ID from /civ invites
Example: /civ accept inv_12345

/civ leave
Leave your civilization (religion founder only). Your religion is removed from the civilization.
Example: /civ leave

/civ kick <religionname>
Kick a religion from your civilization (founder only). The kicked religion can join other civilizations.
Parameters:
• religionname (required) - Religion to kick
Example: /civ kick "Holy Order"

/civ disband
Disband your civilization (founder only). All member religions are removed.
Example: /civ disband

Information Commands

/civ list [deity]
List all civilizations, optionally filtered by deity. Shows member religions and total member count.
Parameters:
• deity (optional) - Filter by deity: Khoras, Lysa, Aethra, or Gaia
Example: /civ list Khoras

/civ info [name]
Show detailed information about a civilization including all member religions, deities, total members, and founder.
Parameters:
• name (optional) - Civilization name (default: your civilization)
Example: /civ info "Grand Alliance"

/civ invites
Show all pending civilization invitations sent to your religion (founder only).
Example: /civ invites

Admin Commands (require admin privileges)

/civ admin create <civname> <religion1> [religion2] [religion3] [religion4]
Force create a civilization with specified religions. Bypasses founder checks and invitations.
Parameters:
• civname (required) - Civilization name
• religion1 (required) - First religion (becomes founder)
• religion2-4 (optional) - Additional religions
Example: /civ admin create "Alliance" "Holy Order" "Nature's Call"

/civ admin dissolve <civname>
Force dissolve a civilization. All member religions are removed.
Parameters:
• civname (required) - Civilization to dissolve
Example: /civ admin dissolve "Grand Alliance"

/civ cleanup (Admin)
Clean up orphaned civilizations and diplomacy data. Use if civilizations show inconsistent state.
Example: /civ cleanup

See also:
Religion Commands
